nodes.text: Glowblue noodles, sometimes served as glowblue noodles and chav was a meal based on blue-hued noodles. The basic recipe was vegetarian and could be modified for a variety of diets. It was topped with a vegetable and a sauce made with butter, cheese, cream, garlic, salt, and pepper. The recipe was created by Chef Gormaanda, who featured it in one of her cooking holovids.

During the Imperial Era, a staged fight between smuggler Han Solo and pirate Hondo Ohnaka on the moon Dhandu 3 turned into a real one when Ohnaka shoved Solo into a table, which collapsed and inadvertently launched a plate of glowblue noodles and chav at a group of Pakiphantos. Artiodac chef Strono Tuggs, who had been inspired to cook by Gormaanda's holovids, was fond of the dish. After the Battle of Takodana in 34 ABY, Tuggs included Gormaanda's recipe in his cookbook and added an optional garnish of Golden Lichen Tuile.

In Star Wars Legends, Glowblue Noodles and Chav was first mentioned in 2002 on the web-publication HoloNet News Vol. 531 50. The dish first appeared in the new Star Wars canon in the 2019 junior novel Pirate's Price, which was written by Lou Anders. They were first pictured in the 2019 recipe book Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, written by Marc Sumerak and Chelsea Monroe-Cassel. The out-of-universe recipe uses the ingredients water, blue butterfly pea tea bags, salt, and rice noodles to create blue-colored noodles. The cheese sauce is made with unsalted butter, minced garlic, salt, pepper, heavy cream, and grated parmesan cheese. The dish is topped with mozzarella pearls and cherry tomatoes, and it can be garnished with Golden Lichen Tuile.
